task.summary:
MVC/Preview Entries
Pulled classes apart into a cleaner MVC organization (although `controller/entries/Edit` and `controller/users/Edit` may not be worth pulling apart) and did a bunch of renaming of classes to more clearly indicate their purpose. A `Detail` class shows full details on an object, while a `Thumbnail` shows just a snapshot preview. In views, I've separated singular and plural views (and the plural views depend on the singular views). This makes the controller classes all verbs (`View`, `Browse`, `Edit`).
It seems like `react-bootstrap` is bogging down horribly if anything needs to be animated.

Converted to ReactStrap
...and basically have the structure working right. Just need to make it pretty now.

react-router/reactstrap foolishness
Sigh. Who gets to build the actual rendered link? Well... it's complicated. ;)

Subdirectory-agnostic
Oy. That was way harder than it should have been! But it should now be possible to serve the app from a subdirectory (rather then the root) of a web server, simply by updating the `.env.local` file to include the appropriate `PUBLIC_URL` information.

Pretty Device previews
Also some source reorganization

Markdown is back
Assuming it compiles on the server.

MESSAGE.value:
MVC/Preview Entries
Pulled classes apart into a cleaner MVC organization (although `controller/entries/Edit` and `controller/users/Edit` may not be worth pulling apart) and did a bunch of renaming of classes to more clearly indicate their purpose. A `Detail` class shows full details on an object, while a `Thumbnail` shows just a snapshot preview. In views, I've separated singular and plural views (and the plural views depend on the singular views). This makes the controller classes all verbs (`View`, `Browse`, `Edit`).
It seems like `react-bootstrap` is bogging down horribly if anything needs to be animated.

Converted to ReactStrap
...and basically have the structure working right. Just need to make it pretty now.

react-router/reactstrap foolishness
Sigh. Who gets to build the actual rendered link? Well... it's complicated. ;)

Subdirectory-agnostic
Oy. That was way harder than it should have been! But it should now be possible to serve the app from a subdirectory (rather then the root) of a web server, simply by updating the `.env.local` file to include the appropriate `PUBLIC_URL` information.

Pretty Device previews
Also some source reorganization

Markdown is back
Assuming it compiles on the server.
